intro: Cleyera lushia, commonly known as the glossyleaf cleyera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves that are thick and glossy, providing a striking visual appearance. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that are edible for some bird species. Cleyera lushia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
